articles.content:
Kim Jong Il enjoys art performance
      Pyongyang, May 19 (KCNA) - General Secretary Kim Jong Il enjoyed an art performance given by dependents of military personnel of KPA units nos. 593 and 337 who participated in the second  competition of art circle members of the dependents of the KPA officers to mark Sun's Day.   Seeing the performance together with him were director Jo Myong Rok of the general political department of the KPA, chief Kim Yong Chun of the general staff of the KPA, Kim Il Chol Minister of the People's Armed Forces and other general officers of the KPA.   
   Put on the stage were colorful numbers, including a chorus "Fortune of Korea," a homophony-tale "We will devotedly serve soldiers," a trio-tale "We are highly proud wives of officers" and a dramatic tale "Heart of Mother."
   General Secretary was much pleased with the excellent performance of art circle members of dependents of military personnel which gave a vivid portrayal of their revolutionary and militant life of romance and warmly congratulated them upon their successful performance.   
   He said the mental world, spirit of struggle and mode of life of the dependents of military personnel are really excellent, which show the ideological, cultural and moral levels of the Korean people who have been tempered in the days of the "arduous march" and forced march as never before.
   He went on to say that art activity is of weighty importance in establishing the revolutionary and militant mode of struggle and life in the whole society.
   He put forward tasks that will be very instrumental in conducting brisk art activity among the people and developing it.

articles.title: S. Korean rulers' suppression of labour movement
articles.content:
Cohen's provocative remarks
    Pyongyang, May 19 (KCNA) -- U.S. Defense Secretary William Cohen at a confab with the "Minister of Foreign Affairs and Trade" of South Korea who visited the United States, on May 14 said that the United States is fully and militarily prepared to cope with any provocation of North Korea without regard to its  military participation in the Kosovo crisis of Yugoslavia, according to a news report.   
   He said that he was taking such necessary steps as establishing a close liaison system with the U.S. forces command present in South Korea and examining the joint U.S.-South Korea "defense" posture.
   He took issue with the DPRK over the Kosovo crisis some time ago and repeated the same this time. His utterances clearly show the U.S. frantic war moves against Yugoslavia are a very dangerous preliminary war, a test war aiming at the DPRK.

articles.content:
Equipment from UNDP
    Pyongyang, May 19 (KCNA) -- Equipment needed for healing damage in the agricultural domain of the DPRK was sent by the United Nations Development Program. 
   The UNDP had sent the DPRK some of equipment to help it recover from natural damage.
   A presentation ceremony took place at Nampho port on May 18.
   Present there were Ri Won Jung, vice-Minister of Agriculture, officials concerned and Christian  Lemaire, resident coordinator of the United Nations and resident representative of the UNDP here.

articles.content:
Publication ceremony held in India
    Pyongyang, May 19 (KCNA) -- A ceremony for publishing volume 3 of part 1 the anti-Japanese revolution of "With the Century", the reminiscences of the Kim Il Sung, was held in New Delhi on May 13.
   The secretary general of the all India Indo-Korean Friendship Association, addressing the ceremony, said that President Kim Il Sung was the people's leader who embarked upon the road of revolution in his early years and devoted all his life to the liberation of the country and the freedom and liberation of the people.
